author: ianjo
message:
Looking great!
From what I've seen in blogs over the years, modernizing/fixing kdm was always "in the plans" but never quite made it, so it's excellent to see that we might instead replace it with lightdm.

Rock on!

author: Yuri Chornoivan
message:
Good work, but are there any plans to make it translatable (add Messages.sh)?

Thanks in advance for your answer.

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: Yes. We already use i18n() calls, but we still have to set up the rest of the translation infrastructure.

author: Lindsay
message: Is it actually the kubuntu teams plan to use LightDM in the future

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: I can't speak on behalf of the whole Kubuntu team, but I think that could happen if LightDM proves to be good enough.

replies.author: Lindsay
replies.message:
Interesting. I've been using the latest builds of LightDM and haven't had any real problems with it apart from some quirks with my font setup being reset to defaults and I can certainly see the future coolness of plasma greeters..

But isn't KDM fairly tightly integrated with KDE? would there be a lot of kde specific extensions you would have to replicate? POOMA U here of course

replies.author: Markus
replies.message:
Considering that KDM is pretty unmaintained (no activity in plasma kdm since 8 months), I wouldn't be surprised if kdm won't survive the KF5 transition at all.
Currently it looks as even rather conservative openSUSE will ship LightDM-KDE as non default package in 12.2. Who knows? Maybe default in 12.3...

replies.author: Lindsay
replies.message:
Interesting, I didn't know such a critical component was languishing. OTOH, if it just works ...

Maybe I should start actively testing LightDM - is it easy to build from trunk? no need for trunk KDE builds?

replies.author: Markus S.
replies.message: Here's the main KDM development branch: https://projects.kde.org/pr... -- many files last touched 2 years ago, only here and there a small change now and then. The Plasma front-end looks pretty dead: https://projects.kde.org/pr... -- last touched 8 months ago without ever reaching shipable state. LightDM-KDE OTOH has almost daily development activity: https://projects.kde.org/pr...

author: box0
message: Hi, i've installed lightdm and the kde greeter in archlinux but it seems i'm not able to figure out how to change the users' avatars. Where should I look?

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message:
Avatar support is a bit of a mess right now. The simplest solution is probably to create a file named ".face" in your home dir. It should be a PNG of say 128x128 or less.

There is a bug in 0.1.0 which prevents this from working with liblightdm-qt 1.2.1. The fix is in the just-created v0.1 branch. Will look into releasing 0.1.1 soon.

replies.author: box0
replies.message: i see, thank you.
